decks.notes: The main focus of this Bant Control deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of powerful creatures and spells. The deck utilizes powerful cards such as Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Elspeth Conquers Death to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in the deck. By utilizing a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long game.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to build up a strong board presence and deal direct damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards with cycling abilities, the player can consistently draw into key pieces of their strategy, such as Zenith Flare, while also enhancing their creatures with cards like Startling Development and Boon of the Wish-Giver. With Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck aims to maintain a steady flow of cards and aggressive plays to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by limiting the opponent's options while generating value with cards like Fires of Invention and Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast. The goal is to stabilize the board with cards like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death, allowing you to take over the game with powerful threats like Agent of Treachery. The deck utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to provide additional value by blinking permanents. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until you can overwhelm your opponent with powerful plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with cards like Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast, Elspeth Conquers Death, and Shatter the Sky. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value with blink effects. The deck also includes cards like Agent of Treachery and Shark Typhoon for additional control and card advantage. Overall, the strategy revolves around establishing board control and out-valuing the opponent through efficient spellcasting and constant card advantage.

This deck focuses on controlling the board with cards like Shatter the Sky and Shark Typhoon, while also utilizing Fires of Invention to cast spells for free. The strategy is to stall the game with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, then quickly turn the tables by cheating out powerful threats like Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast and Agent of Treachery. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as both a companion and a way to reset the board with its flicker effect, providing additional value and control over the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up a board of small, low-cost creatures and then enhance them with various auras and equipment spells to create powerful attackers. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional recursion of key creatures or spells from the graveyard. By utilizing cards like All That Glitters and Shadowspear, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient, evasive threats while also protecting its key creatures with cards like Karametra's Blessing and Alseid of Life's Bounty.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures with the Cycling keyword to quickly cycle through your deck, all while maintaining a low mana curve. With Lurrus of the Dream-Den as your companion, you can continuously bring back low-cost creatures from your graveyard. Cards like Zenith Flare and Valiant Rescuer work well together to deal damage directly to your opponent while also maintaining board presence. By utilizing the Cycling mechanic, you can quickly find your key cards and consistently apply pressure to your opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize sacrifice and recursion mechanics to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent with quick, aggressive plays. By using cards like Cauldron Familiar, Witch's Oven, and Priest of Forgotten Gods to sacrifice creatures and generate value, combined with aggressive creatures like Dreadhorde Butcher and Robber of the Rich, this deck aims to swarm the opponent with relentless aggression. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing you to recur key cards from the graveyard, keeping the pressure on your opponent throughout the game.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful spells and creatures, while also utilizing cards like Quasiduplicate and Mythos of Illuna to create copies of key creatures. The deck also includes cards like Agent of Treachery and Cavalier of Flame to disrupt the opponent's board state and put pressure on them. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion to provide additional value and flexibility in gameplay. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and powerful abilities.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using adventure creature spells and Lucky Clover to cast big threats like Beanstalk Giant and Lovestruck Beast early on. Fae of Wishes allows for additional flexibility in finding answers or threats from the sideboard. Escape to the Wilds provides card advantage and fuels the aggressive tempo. Brazen Borrower and Bonecrusher Giant offer removal and disruption to control the opponent's board. Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast serves as a versatile finisher by cheating out powerful threats from the deck.

The deck focuses on cycling through cards quickly to build up a board of creatures with abilities that trigger when cycling occurs, while also including spells that benefit from discarding and cycling cards. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced aggressive strategy that utilizes cycling and card advantage to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds another layer of consistency and synergy to the deck's game plan.

This aggressive Esper deck focuses on controlling the board with removal spells and disruptive creatures while generating value through cards like Thought Erasure and Elite Guardmage. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of planeswalkers, powerful creatures, and disruptive spells, ensuring that the opponent struggles to stabilize and take control of the game. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value by blinking creatures and permanents for additional triggers and advantages throughout the game. Overall, the deck is designed to apply constant pressure and disruption to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cheat out powerful cards like Agent of Treachery and Shark Typhoon without needing to pay their mana costs. The strategy revolves around controlling the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Shatter the Sky while generating advantage with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Omen of the Sea. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion to provide additional value by flickering permanents for extra ETB effects. Overall, the key concept is to control the game and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on establishing control over the game by utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free. It includes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also using various enchantments like Omen of the Sun and Elspeth Conquers Death to generate value and maintain board presence. The deck also utilizes a companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, to take advantage of its enter-the-battlefield abilities and generate additional card advantage. Ultimately, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of control elements and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of powerful creatures and control spells, all while being able to cast multiple spells for free using Fires of Invention. The deck aims to ramp up its mana quickly, drop big threats like Sphinx of Foresight and Cavalier of Flame, then lock down the opponent's board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Elspeth Conquers Death. It also includes a companion in the form of Keruga, the Macrosage, providing additional card draw and value throughout the game.

The deck focuses on using the Fires of Invention enchantment to play powerful creatures and spells for free. It includes a mix of efficient creatures like Cavalier of Flame and Questing Beast, along with removal and combat tricks like Fire Prophecy and Embercleave. The goal is to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Quartzwood Crasher and Shifting Ceratops. The companion, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, provides an additional benefit to the deck strategy. Mana fixing and card draw are also included to ensure consistency and resilience.

The key strategy of this Sultai Control deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal spells, while gaining card advantage with cards like Tamiyo, Collector of Tales and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. The deck has a focus on powerful late-game threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon, backed up by efficient removal like Extinction Event and Casualties of War. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure smooth mana production for the three-color deck, allowing for consistent access to all the powerful spells in the deck.

This deck focuses on utilizing ramp and land synergy to quickly generate card advantage and powerful board presence. By consistently ramping into powerful threats like Omnath, Locus of the Roil and Genesis Ultimatum, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive game plan. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in gameplay. With a mix of creature threats and powerful spells, this Temur Aggro deck aims to outpace opponents and secure victories through its explosive and versatile strategy.
